result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordon D Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.

- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 
- If defendant pays this off and has no other criminal charges, Court will allow expungement. Defendant needs to apply to the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordon D Payne

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM Defendant Jordon D Payne in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes stip has been filed and recites offer- fine plus costs. ADA McElroy concurs. Defendant concurs and enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. 

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty as charged. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA McElroy. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. If defendant pays this off and has no criminal charges, Court will allow expungement. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 


Court adjourned at 10:13 AM.
Second appearance on April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:49 AM Defendant Jordon D Payne in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. ADA McElroy states he sent the defendant an offer. Court determines def stands mute and enters a not guilty plea on his behalf. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court will set for Status of Counsel April 26, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:51 AM.
